chapter.title: General Principles

para.emphasis: Ergonomics relating to the use of a web application

chapter.para: PMB is a web application, a "WebApp". Running on a web server (see the PMB Installation Guide, Section 1, Installation on Windows, for more information about Apache), PMB benefits from the flexibility of internet applications.

para.emphasis: Don't use the "previous page" browser button.

chapter.para: "Previous page" and "Page forward" allow the movement from one page to another on the internet, it works the same way with PMB.

Warning. Whenever you see on your screen a message starting with Update do not click on previous page. Whenever you see this message, it is vital to leave the update to finish completely. In general, avoid using previous page if you can achieve the same results by clicking on one of the links visible on screen.
The "Reload" button of your browser enables you to reload the page displayed on screen.
Whenever you reload a page which is the result of a form (for example adding a new volume), the data is resubmitted to the server.
Following the same principle as "Previous page", your browser's "Stop" button interrupts the loading of a page.

chapter.para: Warning During important operations on the database (additions, deletions), you should not stop the loading of the page, you would be interrupting the update in progress and putting at risk the integrity of the database.
In particular, never click "cancel" when the database is being restored, backed-up or optimized.
